title:
Data-Centric Elastic Pipeline Parallelism for Efficient Long-Context LLM
  Training
authors: Shiju Wang, Yujie Wang, Ao Sun, Fangcheng Fu, Zijian Zhu, Bin Cui, Xu Han, Kaisheng Ma
summary:
Here is a summary of the article in 2 concise paragraphs:

The article discusses the importance of long context training for Large Language Models (LLMs) in extending their contextual understanding. Existing methods, such as sequence parallelism, are limited by substantial communication overhead. Pipeline parallelism (PP) offers a solution, but its effectiveness depends on the granularity of partitioning. The authors highlight the trade-off between memory consumption and hardware utilization in PP.

To address this challenge, the authors propose Elastic Pipeline Parallelism (EPP), which adapts to resource and workload characteristics by orchestrating token-level and batch-level PP. EPP aims to balance workload scheduling and optimize performance, taking into account the skewness of sequence length distribution in real-world datasets.
